results.title: Under the Skin of Jamie Lee Curtis
results.abstract: Whether it’s her return to her horror roots in “Halloween Ends” or her buzzy performance in “Everything Everywhere All at Once,” freedom is what the actress is after.

multimedia.caption: “I feel all the feels, all the time,” Jamie Lee Curtis said.
multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: “I feel all the feels, all the time,” Jamie Lee Curtis said.

results.title: Angela Lansbury’s Greatest Roles: A Streaming Guide
results.abstract: From appearances in films as varied as “The Manchurian Candidate” to “Beauty and the Beast” to her long run on “Murder, She Wrote” on television, she entertained for decades.

multimedia.caption: Angela Lansbury and James Gregory in “The Manchurian Candidate.”
Angela Lansbury and James Gregory in “The Manchurian Candidate.”
Angela Lansbury and James Gregory in “The Manchurian Candidate.”

results.title: Anthony Rapp Said Anguish Returned When He Saw Kevin Spacey Onscreen
results.abstract: In testimony in a civil trial, Mr. Rapp argued that Mr. Spacey had inflicted emotional distress by climbing atop him in a bed when Mr. Rapp was 14. Mr. Spacey says the encounter didn’t happen.
results.byline: By Julia Jacobs and Nate Schweber

multimedia.caption: “As his name and notoriety increased, it was harder and harder to escape,” Anthony Rapp testified regarding Kevin Spacey.
“As his name and notoriety increased, it was harder and harder to escape,” Anthony Rapp testified regarding Kevin Spacey.
“As his name and notoriety increased, it was harder and harder to escape,” Anthony Rapp testified regarding Kevin Spacey.

results.title: Streaming Services Want to Fill the Family Movie Void
results.abstract: With theatrical releases way down, the streaming giants have been pumping out multigenerational fare, including a number of live-action films.

multimedia.caption: “Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile,” which was released this weekend, is one of an increasingly small number of family films to open in theaters.
“Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile,” which was released this weekend, is one of an increasingly small number of family films to open in theaters.
“Lyle, Lyle, Crocodile,” which was released this weekend, is one of an increasingly small number of family films to open in theaters.

results.title: The Power Player of ‘Triangle of Sadness’: Dolly de Leon
results.abstract: The Palme d’Or-winning class satire hinges on her surprising character, but the veteran Filipina actress never thought she had a chance to land the role.

multimedia.caption: Dolly de Leon in Beverly Hills. “What an incredible feeling to experience something like this, however late in life,” she said.
multimedia.copyright: Rosie Marks for The New York Times

results.title: Five Action Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include films concerning the pain of war and the thrill of revenge.

multimedia.caption: Michael Raymond-James in “American Insurrection.”
Michael Raymond-James in “American Insurrection.”
Michael Raymond-James in “American Insurrection.”

results.title: ‘Tár’ Review: A Maestro Faces the Music
results.abstract: Cate Blanchett stars as a world-famous conductor heading for a fall in Todd Field’s chilly, timely backstage drama.

multimedia.caption: Cate Blanchett as the conductor and composer Lydia Tár in “Tár,” from the director Todd Field.
Cate Blanchett as the conductor and composer Lydia Tár in “Tár,” from the director Todd Field.
Cate Blanchett as the conductor and composer Lydia Tár in “Tár,” from the director Todd Field.

results.title: ‘Triangle of Sadness’ Review: Don’t Worry, Be Happy
results.abstract: Ruben Ostlund won the top prize at Cannes for this preening, obvious satire of contemporary hypocrisy.

multimedia.caption: Charlbi Dean and Harris Dickinson in Ruben Ostlund’s satire “Triangle of Sadness.”
Charlbi Dean and Harris Dickinson in Ruben Ostlund’s satire “Triangle of Sadness.”
Charlbi Dean and Harris Dickinson in Ruben Ostlund’s satire “Triangle of Sadness.”

results.title: ‘Amsterdam’ Review: A Madcap Mystery With Many Whirring Parts
results.abstract: Christian Bale, Margot Robbie and John David Washington lead a crowded cast of zanies in David O. Russell’s latest screwball outing.

multimedia.caption: In “Amsterdam,” Christian Bale, Margot Robbie and John David Washington play three American comrades who met in Europe during World War I.
In “Amsterdam,” Christian Bale, Margot Robbie and John David Washington play three American comrades who met in Europe during World War I.
In “Amsterdam,” Christian Bale, Margot Robbie and John David Washington play three American comrades who met in Europe during World War I.

results.title: ‘Rosaline’ Review: O Romeo, Romeo, Thank U, Next
results.abstract: Kaitlyn Dever plays Romeo’s snarky ex-lover in this Shakespeare reimagining, which crosses its source material with present-day sensibilities.

multimedia.caption: From left, Spencer Stevenson, Kaitlyn Dever, Kyle Allen and Henry Hunter Hall in “Rosaline.”
From left, Spencer Stevenson, Kaitlyn Dever, Kyle Allen and Henry Hunter Hall in “Rosaline.”
From left, Spencer Stevenson, Kaitlyn Dever, Kyle Allen and Henry Hunter Hall in “Rosaline.”

results.title: ‘Dark Glasses’ Review: She Wears Her Shades at Night
results.abstract: A prostitute blinded by a stalker tries to protect a young boy. But in his first film in 10 years, Dario Argento opts for visuals as banal as the scares.

multimedia.caption: Ilenia Pastorelli, left, and Asia Argento in a scene from “Dark Glasses.”
Ilenia Pastorelli, left, and Asia Argento in a scene from “Dark Glasses.”
Ilenia Pastorelli, left, and Asia Argento in a scene from “Dark Glasses.”

results.title: ‘Plan A’ Review: Seeking Vengeance for the Holocaust
results.abstract: Set in postwar Germany, this film dramatizes the true story of a group of Jewish survivors who sought revenge through an astonishing undercover operation.

multimedia.caption: August Diehl stars as a Holocaust survivor in postwar Germany in “Plan A.”
August Diehl stars as a Holocaust survivor in postwar Germany in “Plan A.”
August Diehl stars as a Holocaust survivor in postwar Germany in “Plan A.”

results.title: ‘Eternal Spring’ Review: When State TV Got Hijacked
results.abstract: Two decades after members of Falun Gong took over local television programming in Changchun, China, a documentary looks back.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “Eternal Spring,” an animated documentary film directed by Jason Loftus.
A scene from “Eternal Spring,” an animated documentary film directed by Jason Loftus.
A scene from “Eternal Spring,” an animated documentary film directed by Jason Loftus.

results.title: ‘The Picture Taker’ Review: Civil Rights Photographer and F.B.I. Informant
results.abstract: The documentary, by the director of “Who Killed Malcolm X?,” is a compelling biography of Ernest Withers, whose photographs helped chronicle Black history.

multimedia.caption: A protester in 1960s Memphis. The documentary “The Picture Taker” offers a compelling biography of the photojournalist Ernest Withers.
A protester in 1960s Memphis. The documentary “The Picture Taker” offers a compelling biography of the photojournalist Ernest Withers.
A protester in 1960s Memphis. The documentary “The Picture Taker” offers a compelling biography of the photojournalist Ernest Withers.

results.title: ‘Sell/Buy/Date’ Review: The Topic of Sex Work, From All Sides
results.abstract: In Sarah Jones’s engaging film about the sex trade, everyone has a say.

multimedia.caption: Sarah Jones as herself, left, as Nereida, center, and as Bella, right, in “Sell/Buy/Date.”
Sarah Jones as herself, left, as Nereida, center, and as Bella, right, in “Sell/Buy/Date.”
Sarah Jones as herself, left, as Nereida, center, and as Bella, right, in “Sell/Buy/Date.”

results.title: ‘Sepa, Nuestro Señor de los Milagros’ Review: A Prison in the Jungle
results.abstract: A documentary from the 1980s, now premiering in a restored version, is an eye-opening visit to a Peruvian penal colony.
des_facet: Sepa, Nuestro Senor de los Milagros (Movie)

multimedia.caption: A still from the documentary “Sepa, Nuestro Señor de los Milagros.”
A still from the documentary “Sepa, Nuestro Señor de los Milagros.”

results.title: ‘Stars at Noon’ Review: A Not-So-Innocent Abroad
results.abstract: Claire Denis’s captivating new film, starring Margaret Qualley and based on the novel by Denis Johnson, treads familiar territory in a foreign land.

multimedia.caption: Margaret Qualley and Joe Alwyn in “Stars at Noon,” by Claire Denis.
Margaret Qualley and Joe Alwyn in “Stars at Noon,” by Claire Denis.
Margaret Qualley and Joe Alwyn in “Stars at Noon,” by Claire Denis.

results.title: ‘The Other Tom’ Review: A Parent’s Right to Choose
results.abstract: A single mother in Texas faces off against the state when she refuses to medicate her son’s A.D.H.D.

multimedia.caption: Julia Chavez in “The Other Tom,” directed by Laura Santullo and Rodrigo Plá.
Julia Chavez in “The Other Tom,” directed by Laura Santullo and Rodrigo Plá.
Julia Chavez in “The Other Tom,” directed by Laura Santullo and Rodrigo Plá.

results.title: Angela Lansbury, Broadway’s Beloved Everywoman
results.abstract: She performed without sentimentality or histrionics, embodying the full range of human joy and depravity while remaining professional and approachable.

multimedia.caption: “I absorb everything,” Angela Lansbury told Jesse Green in 2007. She needed to play many different kinds of characters, he writes, to make the best yield of all she’d observed.
“I absorb everything,” Angela Lansbury told Jesse Green in 2007. She needed to play many different kinds of characters, he writes, to make the best yield of all she’d observed.
“I absorb everything,” Angela Lansbury told Jesse Green in 2007. She needed to play many different kinds of characters, he writes, to make the best yield of all she’d observed.

results.title: American Culture Is Trash Culture
results.abstract: It’s not just that trash is what Americans want from movies; it’s who we are. So where did it go?

results.title: ‘Almost Famous’ Heads to Broadway, Purple Aura Intact
results.abstract: Cameron Crowe adapted his Oscar-winning screenplay, about writing for Rolling Stone in the ’70s, preserving parts of the movie’s soundtrack and zingers (Don’t take drugs!) for the stage.

multimedia.caption: The musical-theater version of “Almost Famous” is “meant to capture the same thing as the movie,” Cameron Crowe said, “a personal story with music that you love.”
multimedia.copyright: Magdalena Wosinska for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: The musical-theater version of “Almost Famous” is “meant to capture the same thing as the movie,” Cameron Crowe said, “a personal story with music that you love.”

results.title: How Russian Action Movies Are Selling War
results.abstract: For an American, it can be easy to forget how much ideology is packed into the genre — until you watch a film from elsewhere, and see their cartoonish heroes and villains.

results.title: Eileen Ryan, Actress of Stage and Screen, Dies at 94
results.abstract: She put her career on hold for a time to raise her sons, the actors Sean and Chris Penn and the musician Michael Penn.

multimedia.caption: The actress Eileen Ryan in 2007 with her son Sean Penn at the Los Angeles premiere of the film “Into the Wild,” which he directed.
The actress Eileen Ryan in 2007 with her son Sean Penn at the Los Angeles premiere of the film “Into the Wild,” which he directed.
The actress Eileen Ryan in 2007 with her son Sean Penn at the Los Angeles premiere of the film “Into the Wild,” which he directed.

results.title: Nikki Finke, Caustic Hollywood Chronicler, Is Dead at 68
results.abstract: At newspapers and then at Deadline, the website she founded, she served up the opposite of fluff entertainment journalism.

multimedia.caption: Nikki Finke in an undated photo. “Here’s what makes me weird,” she said of her Hollywood coverage. “I care about what happens in the boardroom, not the celebrities.”
Nikki Finke in an undated photo. “Here’s what makes me weird,” she said of her Hollywood coverage. “I care about what happens in the boardroom, not the celebrities.”
Nikki Finke in an undated photo. “Here’s what makes me weird,” she said of her Hollywood coverage. “I care about what happens in the boardroom, not the celebrities.”

results.title: Douglas Kirkland, Who Took Portraits of Movie Stars, Dies at 88
results.abstract: His many memorable shots included one of his earliest assignments and probably his most famous: Marilyn Monroe in bed, wrapped in a silk sheet.

multimedia.caption: Douglas Kirkland photographing Marilyn Monroe in 1961. “I had everything technically right,” he later recalled, “but it was Marilyn Monroe who really created these images.”
Douglas Kirkland photographing Marilyn Monroe in 1961. “I had everything technically right,” he later recalled, “but it was Marilyn Monroe who really created these images.”
Douglas Kirkland photographing Marilyn Monroe in 1961. “I had everything technically right,” he later recalled, “but it was Marilyn Monroe who really created these images.”

results.title: ‘Pretty Problems’ Review: A Getaway Goes Quirky
results.abstract: A woman spends a weekend with some wealthy new acquaintances and discovers something (though not nearly enough) about herself.

multimedia.caption: From left, Britt Rentschler, JJ Nolan, Graham Outerbridge, Alex Klein, Charlotte Ubben and Michael Tennant in “Pretty Problems.”
From left, Britt Rentschler, JJ Nolan, Graham Outerbridge, Alex Klein, Charlotte Ubben and Michael Tennant in “Pretty Problems.”
From left, Britt Rentschler, JJ Nolan, Graham Outerbridge, Alex Klein, Charlotte Ubben and Michael Tennant in “Pretty Problems.”

results.title: An Empress Ahead of Her Time Is Having a Pop Culture Moment
results.abstract: A Netflix series and a new movie explore the life of Elisabeth, the 19th-century Empress of Austria who had a tattoo, worked out daily and wanted more from life than just producing heirs.

multimedia.caption: Vicky Krieps as the empress in “Corsage,” a film by Marie Kreutzer that opens in the United States in December.
Vicky Krieps as the empress in “Corsage,” a film by Marie Kreutzer that opens in the United States in December.
Vicky Krieps as the empress in “Corsage,” a film by Marie Kreutzer that opens in the United States in December.

results.title: ‘Luckiest Girl Alive’ Review: Lean In, to Outrage
results.abstract: Mila Kunis plays a successful career woman who faces a horrific incident from her past in this drama based on the novel by Jessica Knoll.

multimedia.caption: Mila Kunis as Ani in “Luckiest Girl Alive.”
Mila Kunis as Ani in “Luckiest Girl Alive.”
Mila Kunis as Ani in “Luckiest Girl Alive.”

results.title: ‘Significant Other’ Review: Backpacking Is a Trip
results.abstract: Jake Lacy and Maika Monroe play a camping couple in this slick thriller that uses its modest facade as a smoke screen.

multimedia.caption: Maika Monroe in “Significant Other.”
Maika Monroe in “Significant Other.”
Maika Monroe in “Significant Other.”

results.title: ‘Battleground’ Review: A Look at the Anti-Abortion Movement
results.abstract: Months after Roe v. Wade was overturned, this documentary provides, if nothing else, a glimpse into the minds of the mobilized minority leading the anti-abortion charge.

multimedia.caption: Activists on both sides of the abortion debate at the Supreme Court in the documentary “Battleground.”
Activists on both sides of the abortion debate at the Supreme Court in the documentary “Battleground.”
Activists on both sides of the abortion debate at the Supreme Court in the documentary “Battleground.”

results.title: Netflix’s ‘Knives Out’ Sequel Headed to Theaters Before Streaming
results.abstract: “Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery” will receive a weeklong release in about 600 theaters in the United States a month before it becomes available on Netflix.

multimedia.caption: Daniel Craig, right, leads a starry cast in the sequel to the sleeper 2019 hit “Knives Out.”
Daniel Craig, right, leads a starry cast in the sequel to the sleeper 2019 hit “Knives Out.”
Daniel Craig, right, leads a starry cast in the sequel to the sleeper 2019 hit “Knives Out.”

results.title: ‘Onoda: 10,000 Nights in the Jungle’ Review: Following Orders, for Decades
results.abstract: Arthur Harari's film dramatizes the true story of a Japanese officer who continued the fight for 29 years after the Imperial Army’s surrender in World War II.

multimedia.caption: Kanji Tsuda in “Onoda: 10,000 Nights in the Jungle.”
Kanji Tsuda in “Onoda: 10,000 Nights in the Jungle.”
Kanji Tsuda in “Onoda: 10,000 Nights in the Jungle.”

results.title: ‘The Swimmer’ Review: Tough Competition, In and Out of the Pool
results.abstract: The writer-director Adam Kalderon renders his film with style and rich psychology.

multimedia.caption: Asaf Jonas, left, with Omer Perelman Striks in “The Swimmer.”
Asaf Jonas, left, with Omer Perelman Striks in “The Swimmer.”
Asaf Jonas, left, with Omer Perelman Striks in “The Swimmer.”

results.title: Second City to Open Its First New York Outpost
results.abstract: Long a staple of Chicago, the improv and sketch company plans to open a theater and training center in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn next year.
